message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with scene understanding from images, which is a core problem in computer vision. The proposed approach is specifically focused on inferring the 3D rigid-body poses and shapes of vehicles from stereo images of road scenes, which falls under the category of robotics and autonomous driving scenarios. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper also proposes an adaptive sparse point selection scheme, which involves machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also involves optimization techniques for efficient shape and pose estimation, which can be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Furthermore, the paper involves geometric alignment and 3D object detection, which can be categorized under cs.GR (Graphics). Finally, the paper also involves robotics and autonomous driving scenarios, which can be categorized under cs.RO (Robotics).
